CLUE: Critical evaluation, of a book say
OUTPUT: ['Here are steps that could guide you through critical evaluation:', "Summary - Begin by summarizing the main plot, themes, or arguments of the book without giving away any spoilers if it's a narrative work.", 'Context - Consider the context in which the book was written, including historical, cultural, and personal influences that may have affected its content.', 'Structure & Style - Analyze the structure (linear or non-linear), pacing, chapter breaks, point of view, writing style, language use, symbolism, metaphors, and any literary devices used by the author.', 'Character Development - In narrative works, evaluate how well characters are developed, their complexity, growth throughout the story, and consistency', "Themes & Ideas - Identify major themes or ideas within the book and discuss how effectively they're explored through plot, character interactions, settings, etc.", 'Argumentation - In non-fiction works, assess the strength of the argument presented by considering logic, evidence, counterarguments, and rebuttals offered by the author.', 'Originality & Contribution - Determine if the book offers new insights or perspectives on its subject matter and how it contributes to existing literature or discussions within that field.', 'Impact & Relevance - Discuss what impact the book might have on readers, society, or a particular discourse, as well as its potential relevance over time.', 'Criticisms - Point out any areas of weakness in the narrative structure, argumentation, character development, language use, etc., and discuss how they affect the overall quality of the book.', 'Conclusion & Recommendations: Summarize your findings and provide a balanced conclusion that reflects both strengths and areas for improvement']
